text: The 1949 Tour de Hongrie was the 14th edition of the Tour de Hongrie cycle race and was held from 29 June to 3 July 1949. The race started and finished in Budapest. The race was won by André Labeylie. ==Route== {| class="wikitable" |+ Stages of the 1949 Tour de Hongrie |- ! scope="col" | Stage ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Route ! scope="col" | Distance ! scope="col" | Winner |- ! scope="col" | 1 | style="text-align:right;" | 29 June | Budapest to Debrecen | | |- ! scope="col" | 2 | style="text- align:right;" | 30 June | Debrecen to Miskolc | | |- ! scope="col" | 3 | style="text-align:right;" | 1 July | Miskolc to Budapest | | |- ! scope="col" | 4 | style="text-align:right;" | 2 July | Budapest to Keszthely | | |- ! scope="col" | 5 | style="text-align:right;" | 3 July | Keszthely to Budapest | | |- | colspan="3" style="text-align:center" | Total | colspan="2" style="text-align:center" | '''''' |} ==General classification== {| |Final general classification {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col" | Rank ! scope="col" | Rider ! scope="col" | Team ! scope="col" | Time |- | style="text-align:center;" | 1 | | France | style="text-align:right;" | |- | style="text-align:center;" | 2 | | Austria | style="text-align:right;" | + 10' 01" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 3 | | France | style="text-align:right;" | + 15' 02" |} |} ==References== 1949 Tour de Hongrie Tour de Hongrie
